revised_title: On the Structure and Affinities of Fossil Plants from Palaeozoic Rocks: Medullosa anglica, a New Representative of the Cycadofilices
tldr: The author examines the structure and affinities of fossil plants from Palaeozoic rocks, specifically focusing on Medullosa anglica, a new representative of the Cycadofilices. The study reveals that these plants have a complex structure, with numerous vascular rings and a combination of Fern and Cycadaceae characteristics. The author also discusses the significance of these findings and the relation of the fossil to Brongniart's genus Colpoxylon.
